definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The traditional libraries in China were unenlightened and just opened for few people.
sentences.chinese: 传统中国藏书机构是封闭，并且只提供少数的人使用。

sentences.english: During the years of Jiajing in Ming Dynasty, a scholar named Fan Qin had a hobby in collecting books.
sentences.chinese: 明代嘉靖年间有一个人叫范钦，一生嗜好藏书。

sentences.english: Moving books from the bookshelf is a hard work in the library.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆藏书倒架是一项专业性较强的繁重工作。

sentences.english: They strolled though the market, his bibliophilic eye studying the wares.
sentences.chinese: 他们漫步地穿过市场，他藏书者的眼睛研究着展品。

sentences.english: This library has a moderate number of books.
sentences.chinese: 这个图书馆的藏书量处于中等。

sentences.english: The number of the books in our library is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 我们图书馆的藏书量在增加。

sentences.english: Professor Hunter have a library of about five thousand book.
sentences.chinese: 汉特教授约有五千册藏书。
我的父亲是一位藏书家。

sentences.english: Eventually, these books will build up into a fine library.
sentences.chinese: 最终，这些书集聚成为一间很好的藏书室。

sentences.english: Tianyi Pavilion Library is the earliest library of China.
sentences.chinese: 天一阁是我国目前现存的最早的私人藏书楼。

sentences.english: He is married and owns a fine home and the most extensive private library in the State.
sentences.chinese: 他已结婚，家庭美满，并拥有州里最大的私人藏书室。

sentences.english: You can borrow this dictionary from the library.
sentences.chinese: 你能够从藏书楼借到这本词典。

sentences.english: He was also a famous book collector and epigrapher in Shantong area during Qian Long period.
sentences.chinese: 他也是乾隆朝山东著名的藏书家及金石学家。

sentences.english: This library came to stand for his belief in learning and truth.
sentences.chinese: 这个藏书室代表了他对于求知和真理的信念。

sentences.english: The second part then assigns name to the circumstance to a private library to make the study slightly.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分则对宋代私人藏书楼的命名情况略作探讨。

definition: a store room for books/fig. an erudite person/the Bibliotheca and Epitome of pseudo-Apollodorus
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
teashop with performance by 評書|评书 story tellers/(attached to name of publishing houses)/(in former times) private school/library (of classic texts)
to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
Siku Quanshu (collection of books compiled during Qing dynasty)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
